issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NN periodically unlinks lazy persist files with missing replicas from namespace

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
bq. but I think it is simple enough to change the meaning of the value so that zero means 'never scrub'. Let me post an updated patch.

As discussed in [HDFS-6929|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-6929], scrubber should be disable if *dfs.namenode.lazypersist.file.scrub.interval.sec* is zero.

Currently namenode startup is failing if interval configured zero

{code}
2015-04-27 23:47:31,744 ERROR org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSNamesystem: FSNamesystem initialization failed.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: dfs.namenode.lazypersist.file.scrub.interval.sec must be non-zero.
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSNamesystem.<init>(FSNamesystem.java:828)
{code}
fields.summary: LazyPersistFileScrubber should be disabled if scrubber interval configured zero

comments.body: [~arpitagarwal] Please can you review this patch.

Thanks for fixing this [~surendrasingh]. Just a nitpick, there should be spaces between the {{else}} and the braces on line 1176. +1 with that fixed.

Also see if you want to add a unit test. It should be fairly simple.

\\
\\

Failed test cases and find bugs are not related to this jira.

Thanks [~arpitagarwal] for review.
Attached new patch, added test case. Please review.

Thanks for the update and adding a test case. 

We can simplify the test case later - just assert that the scrubber object is null e.g.
{{assertThat(cluster.getFsNameSystem().lazyPersistFileScrubber, is(null));}}

+1 pending Jenkins.
